Gorgeous, fresh bitter. Holds hops lightly and well balanced. Some citrus through. Totally enjoyable.....

Bottle. Light orange gold, foamy lively bubbly white head, lacy tracings. Bright and refreshing, full of fresh pear, lemony citrus, crisp bitter finish. Loads of character for a smaller beer, and just pitch-perfect as a session bitter.

Bottle sampled at Mondial de la biÃ¨re 2011. Clear dark golden with no head. Aroma is toasted malt, citrusy hops with some floral and fruity notes. Flavor is toasted malt, some fruity notes, astringency and minerals. Medium body with almost no carbonation.

My Bottom Line:
This BitterÂ’s pleasant leafy and citrusy hop resins evolve in a soft, lush body, but this bottleÂ’s aroma was really not an attractive prelude to the flavor profile.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam circles the hazy honeyed gold.
-A rubbery, phenolic touch in the nose marred most of the experience for me.
-The bright second half of each sip benefits from a citrusy hop comeback.
-The hop aroma is faint compared to the finishing bitterness. Either this bottle is not fresh (quite possible) or the aroma doesnÂ’t appropriately announce what is to come. 
-Malts provide sustenance in the form of light toast and caramel, but hops tend to take over here. I wish I had tried this from a cask first...
